summary: Plan a custom, mobile-compatible website running on the ICP blockchain for UNO/ULO lease listings and lease-code distribution, using unitynodes.club as UI inspiration but aligning product/content guidance with https://unitynodes.io (Unity mobile app is not ICP-powered). The site should clearly communicate there is a single UNO/admin offering ULO lease codes, and ULO users only browse listings and copy lease codes for use in the Unity App (no additional ULO functionality).
architectural_notes: Starting point/reference implementation: https://unitynodes.club to be modified/customized.
Add responsive/mobile-first design requirements for all core flows (public pages + authenticated dashboard).
Content/branding reference source: https://unitynodes.io and its media kit assets.
Product constraint: Only one UNO/admin will offer ULO lease codes; public copy and flows should reflect a single-offer/operator model.
Product constraint: Unity mobile app is not ICP-powered; only this website is deployed on ICP and should avoid implying the Unity leasing service/app runs on ICP.
Product constraint: ULO users only browse listings and copy lease codes for use in the Unity App; no other ULO-facing functions are provided.
Security requirement: Admin/dashboard access should be restricted to an allowlist containing the UNO's Internet Identity principal (single-admin mode).
Home page copy should remove/avoid the "UnityNodes" branding/name and the provided headline/UNO section text; keep messaging aligned with the single-UNO, ULO-browse/copy-code scope constraints.
Add public-facing app download CTAs linking to Google Play and Apple App Store (Unity Network App) on relevant pages (e.g., Home and/or How It Works).
known_issues: Safety system may block sharing of the user's Internet Identity principal, preventing configuration of single-admin allowlist via chat.
Build/deploy action to 'make the site live' intermittently fails with an error ('AI couldn't process your request successfully').
Draft environment may fail to load some images and YouTube embeds, causing media not to appear in draft previews.
User reports being unable to log in to the site via Internet Identity (II sign-in flow not completing).
Creating a lease listing can fail with "Actor not available" error (frontend unable to create authenticated actor / identity not available).
After logging out of the UNO dashboard, newly-updated lease code listings may not appear on the public site (public listings/details rendering issue when only Lease Code + Split Ratio are present).
YouTube video embeds/Shorts section not working (videos do not play/load).
User reports seeing "Actor not available" error when attempting to log in (II/authenticated actor creation failing during login flow).
Production shows "Initialization Error" (trouble setting up session; suggests refresh) during/after login initialization.
Production shows "Connection Issue" / unable to establish connection to backend (possible canister/agent/network failure) alongside initialization error.

existing_features.title: Create a public-facing website UI inspired by https://unitynodes.club (layout and interaction patterns), but implemented as a standalone React app running on the Internet Computer.
Implement Internet Identity authentication so a user can sign in/out and the app can identify the current principal for lease actions.
Build a public Lease Listings page that displays active lease offers and a Lease Details view for a selected offer.
Add a lease request workflow: allow a signed-in user to submit a request for a specific lease offer, and persist those requests on the backend.
Add an authenticated UNO dashboard for the lease owner to manage offers and review incoming lease requests for their offers.
Apply a distinct, coherent visual theme (not blue/purple) across the site with consistent typography, spacing, and component styling appropriate for a professional leasing/validator-style product.
Add generated static image assets for the site (logo/hero accents) and render them from frontend/public/assets/generated (not via the backend).

Update user-facing marketing copy and outbound links so the site clearly represents an ICP-deployed app aligned with https://unitynodes.io (and does not imply that the UnityNodes leasing service itself runs on ICP). Include a clear external link to https://unitynodes.io for more information.

Ensure the website is fully mobile-device compatible (responsive layout and interaction) across key pages: Landing, Lease Listings, Lease Details, How It Works, and Dashboard (including tabs). Fix any overflow, cramped layouts, or non-tap-friendly controls on small screens.

Incorporate approved brand/media images from https://unitynodes.io/media-kit.html into the site as static frontend assets and use them in appropriate public-facing sections (e.g., Landing hero/feature area and/or Footer). Do not serve these images via the backend.

Add an instructional video section that embeds relevant YouTube Shorts from https://www.youtube.com/@UnityNodesIO/shorts related to ULO signups and management. The embeds must be responsive and usable on mobile.

Update the step-card copy on the How It Works page (frontend/src/pages/HowItWorksPage.tsx) to reflect the ULO flow and include the user-provided wording, specifically: (1) set the first step title to "Browse Listings" with description "Explore available ULO lease code opportunities." and (2) replace the current "Submit a Request" step with copy that explains copying the lease code for use in the Unity app (e.g., title "Copy the Lease Code" and description "Found a listing you like? Copy the code for use in the Unity App"). Remove or rewrite any step text that implies ULO users must sign in or submit requests if that is no longer the intended flow for this page.

Expand the How It Works page content to provide more detailed guidance modeled after the level of detail on https://unitynodes.club/en/unity-license-operator-guide/ while keeping all user-facing text in English and aligned with this app’s scope (ULO users browse listings and copy lease codes for use in the Unity app; UnityNodes service itself is external). Add additional structured sections below the step cards (and above or below the existing YouTubeShortsSection as appropriate) such as: what a lease code is, prerequisites before browsing, how to copy/use a code in the Unity app, common issues/troubleshooting, and a short FAQ. Keep the existing external link to https://unitynodes.io.

Update the Home page (frontend/src/pages/LandingPage.tsx) to remove UnityNodes branding and the specified UnityNodes/UNO marketing copy. Specifically: remove the UnityNodes wordmark/logo block in the hero section; remove the hero text that mentions "UnityNodes" and "This ICP-powered app helps Unity License Operators (ULOs) manage lease listings and requests"; and remove the entire "About UnityNodes" section (including its text, image, and button) so that no UnityNodes-branded section remains on the Home page.

Update the site footer content (frontend/src/components/layout/Footer.tsx) so that, when viewed on the Home page, it does not display UnityNodes branding or the specific tagline text "ICP-powered lease management app for Unity License Operators.". Remove UnityNodes name/logo references from the footer and replace the tagline with neutral app text that does not mention UnityNodes.

Update the How It Works page (frontend/src/pages/HowItWorksPage.tsx) to remove the specified instructional steps and listing attribute/filter-description text. Specifically remove: (a) the two ordered-list items under the "Copy the Lease Code" section: "Click on the listing to view its full details" and "Locate the lease code displayed on the listing detail page"; and (b) the listing attribute definitions and filter guidance under "Browse Available Listings": the "Location", "Area", and "Capacity" bullet definitions and the sentence "Use the filter options to narrow down listings by location, area, or capacity to find the perfect match for your needs.". After removal, ensure the remaining text still reads naturally in English (adjust surrounding sentences/intro text only as needed without adding new concepts).

Add a prominent, mobile-responsive "Get the Unity Network App" section that links to the official app store pages: Google Play https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=io.unitynodes.unityapp and Apple App Store https://apps.apple.com/us/app/unity-network-app/id6755482738. Place this section on the public site (at minimum on the Home/Landing page) and ensure the links open in a new tab with proper rel attributes.

Download and add UnityNodes media-kit logo assets from https://unitynodes.io/media-kit.html into the frontend as static public assets, prioritizing the available logos, and use them in the UI where appropriate (e.g., within the new download section and/or header/footer), without serving these images via the backend.

Update user-facing text around the app-download links and any displayed media-kit logos to be in English and to clearly indicate these are external app store destinations (no implication that the Unity mobile app itself runs on ICP).
Remove the "List Your Lease" call-to-action from the Home/Landing page hero section so the Home page no longer offers a direct "List Your Lease" path to the dashboard.

Update the authenticated UNO dashboard lease listing editor UI to allow entering and editing (1) the lease code UUID string and (2) the split ratio in "NLO/ULO" format (e.g., "60/40"), and pass these values through the existing create/update listing mutations to the backend.
Display the lease code and split ratio on the public Lease Details page in a clear English presentation that explicitly attributes the first split value to NLO and the second split value to ULO.

Remove the entire "For Unity Node Operators (UNOs)" promotional section from the How It Works page (frontend/src/pages/HowItWorksPage.tsx), including its heading, description, paragraph, bullet list, and the "Go to Dashboard" button/link, so this UNO/dashboard call-to-action no longer appears on the page.

Update the frontend routing strategy so the app works reliably when deployed live on the Internet Computer, including direct navigation and browser refresh on non-root routes (e.g., /listings, /listings/:listingId, /how-it-works, /dashboard) without returning a 404.

Update the Dashboard "Create Lease Listing" / "Edit Lease Listing" dialog (frontend/src/components/dashboard/LeaseOfferEditorDialog.tsx) so the only user-input required fields are: Listing ID, Lease Code (UUID string), and Split Ratio (NLO/ULO, e.g., 60/40). Remove Location, Area, and Capacity from the required validation and from the primary form UI (they may be omitted entirely or moved into an optional/advanced section that is not required to submit).

Ensure the dashboard create/update listing mutations still send valid values to the existing backend API even when Location/Area/Capacity are not entered by the user, by automatically supplying safe defaults in the dialog submit handler (e.g., Location="Unspecified", Area=0, Capacity=0) while preserving the user-entered Listing ID, Lease Code, and Split Ratio.

Update the frontend dashboard “Create/Edit Lease Listing” flow so only Listing ID, Lease Code (UUID), and Split Ratio (NLO/ULO) are required inputs, and ensure the create/update mutations match the updated backend API (no required Location/Area/Capacity fields).

Remove Location/Area/Capacity as required “headings” in the public lease browsing UI by not displaying those fields when they are absent, and ensure the listings and details pages still render cleanly with the new optional listing fields.

Fix public visibility so active lease listings (lease code + split ratio + availability status) are readable by any site visitor even when no one is logged in, and newly-updated listings remain visible after the admin logs out.

Add an explicit lease availability status field to each lease listing that the admin can update in the dashboard, persist in the backend, and display publicly alongside the lease code and split ratio.

Update the public lease browsing UI so public visitors see ONLY: Lease Code (UUID), Split Ratio (with NLO and ULO attribution), and Availability Status; do not show Location/Area/Capacity or any sorting/filtering based on those fields.
Add public-facing messaging tied to availability status so visitors are clearly informed when a lease code is already in use and should try a different listing/code.

Update the top navigation authentication button label so that when the user is not authenticated it displays "Admin Login" (or "Admin Only") instead of "Login", while keeping the authenticated state label as "Logout" and the in-progress label as "Logging in...".

Fix the embedded YouTube Shorts so the videos actually load and play anywhere the instructional video section appears (e.g., How It Works and Dashboard). Replace the placeholder video IDs in frontend/src/components/media/YouTubeShortsSection.tsx with real video IDs from https://www.youtube.com/@UnityNodesIO/shorts and ensure each iframe uses a valid embed URL for those Shorts.

Harden the YouTube embed implementation for reliability and performance: add safe iframe attributes for modern browsers and keep the embeds mobile-responsive (Shorts aspect ratio) without layout overflow.

Mask the displayed Lease Code in the public lease browsing UI so visitors only see (a) the first 4 characters from the start of the lease code and (b) the first 4 characters from the segment after the last hyphen, while never changing the underlying full lease code value.
Ensure the Copy-to-Clipboard action on the public Lease Details page copies the full, unmasked lease code string even though the UI displays a masked version.

Prevent the UI from surfacing the raw error message "Actor not available" during the Internet Identity login flow by ensuring no queries or UI flows attempt authenticated canister calls until a backend actor instance is ready after login.

Update frontend hooks that currently throw "Actor not available" (e.g., user profile and dashboard mutations) to handle the "actor not ready" state gracefully (do not throw this message; instead keep queries disabled or return a safe no-op/blocked state) and provide a clear, English user-facing message only when the user actually tries to perform an action that requires a ready actor.

Add defensive UX around login initialization so users can understand and recover if the authenticated actor never becomes available (e.g., show a concise English error state with a retry action and/or suggestion to refresh), without exposing internal error strings.

Update the authenticated-session initialization flow so it can distinguish between (a) a slow/timeout actor initialization and (b) an explicit failure to create the backend actor (e.g., network/canister connectivity error), and present the appropriate error UI state instead of always timing out.

Add a non-refresh recovery action for initialization failures that retries actor creation and dependent queries without requiring a full page reload, while keeping the existing refresh option available.

Ensure the user-facing copy for initialization/connection errors is English and consistent across the auth-guard UI, matching the intended wording for the two error states (Initialization Error and Connection Issue).

Fix the dashboard authentication flow so that an admin can successfully sign in with Internet Identity and access /dashboard without getting stuck in an endless initialization state or failing silently.

Correct actor-readiness detection for authenticated sessions so the app reliably creates and uses an authenticated backend actor after login (including re-initializing access control via _initializeAccessControlWithSecret) and accurately transitions between initializing, ready, and error states.

Make the RequireAuth unauthenticated dashboard gate consistent with the single-admin intent by updating its login CTA copy to be admin-specific and in English (align with the TopNav login label behavior).

new_feature_requests.summary: Create a custom ICP blockchain website based on https://unitynodes.club
Add functionality for a UNO to list and lease out leases (lease offering/management workflow)
Define and implement the backend data model and API for lease listings, including creating, reading, updating, and archiving lease offers owned by a UNO principal.
Ensure the website is fully mobile-device compatible (responsive design across key pages and dashboard) for ICP deployment
Incorporate approved brand/media assets from https://unitynodes.io/media-kit.html into the site (images/branding where appropriate)
Embed/feature relevant instructional YouTube Shorts from https://www.youtube.com/@UnityNodesIO/shorts related to ULO signups and management

Update/expand the 'How It Works' page copy/steps to better explain the ULO flow (browse listings, copy lease code for use in the Unity App) and model the level of detail after https://unitynodes.club/en/unity-license-operator-guide/
Add admin access control to lock the authenticated dashboard/admin functions to a single approved Internet Identity principal (UNO-only admin)

Simplify/update public marketing wording across the site to clearly state there is only one UNO offering ULO lease codes, the Unity app is not ICP-powered, and ULO users only obtain lease codes (no other client functions)
Remove specific instructional steps and listing attribute/filter-description text from the How It Works page
Add prominent onsite links/buttons to download the Unity Network App from Google Play and Apple App Store
Remove the "List your lease" call-to-action/section from the Home (Landing) page
Support backend storage/ingestion of lease codes as UUID strings with an associated split ratio (e.g., 60/40) and clear attribution (first value to NLO, second to ULO)

Update the backend lease listing data model and Candid API to support storing a lease code as a UUID string (e.g., "2793ff69-b468-4342-b3cd-3956a4822003") together with a split ratio expressed as two numeric parts (e.g., "60/40"), where the first value is attributed to NLO and the second value is attributed to ULO.
Remove the "For Unity Node Operators (UNOs)" section and its associated UNO/dashboard promotional copy from the How It Works page
Simplify UNO dashboard 'Create Lease Listing' form so only required fields are Listing ID, Lease Code (UUID), and Split Ratio
Update backend lease listing model/API so Location, Area, and Capacity are optional/not required; only Lease Code (UUID) and Split Ratio are required end-to-end
Update the backend lease listing data model and public Candid API so that Location, Area, and Capacity are optional/not required, and only Lease Code and Split Ratio are required for lease listings.
Add an availability/status field for each lease code listing that UNO can set in the dashboard and that is displayed publicly alongside Lease Code + Split Ratio
Support single-use lease codes per client and indicate to users when a code is already in use so they should try the next code

Enforce single-admin control for lease listing management so only one approved Internet Identity principal can access/update lease offerings (create/update/archive listings and change availability), while all other users/visitors remain read-only.
Change the site login button label to reflect single-admin usage (e.g., "Admin Login" or "Admin Only" instead of "Login")
Mask lease codes in the UI: only display the first 4 characters and the first 4 characters after the last hyphen, while copying still copies the full lease code
